reuze

Class das_TreeBestFirst

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuze.das_SearchProblemPriority
      • reuze.das_TreeBestFirst
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    das_i_SearchProblem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    das_TreeAstar, das_TreeBestFirstGreedy

    public class das_TreeBestFirst
extends das_SearchProblemPriority
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 92.

    Best-first search is an instance of the general TREE-SEARCH or GRAPH-SEARCH algorithm in which a node is selected for expansion based on an evaluation function, f(n). The evaluation function is construed as a cost estimate, so the node with the lowest evaluation is expanded first. The implementation of best-first graph search is identical to that for uniform-cost search (Figure 3.14), except for the use of f instead of g to order the priority queue.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone, Ruediger Lunde
